ingredients.name: milk (batter)
ingredients.notes: 78 ml (may add 1–2 Tbsp more if batter is thick)

ingredients.name: apple
ingredients.notes: rinsed, peeled optional, diced into small chunks

task.description: Set oven temperature to 400°F (205°C) and allow to fully preheat.

instructions.original_text: In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, cinnamon, and nutmeg.

task.description: Add flour, granulated sugar, salt, baking powder, cinnamon, and nutmeg to a medium bowl and whisk until uniform.
output_quality: Dry mix is homogeneous with no visible clumps

failure: visible clumps of flour or spices

instructions.original_text: In a large bowl, whisk together the egg, oil, milk, and vanilla extract. Then add the flour mixture and mix, using a silicone or wooden spoon. It may be a little thick; if so, add 1 to 2 additional Tbsp of milk.

task.description: Whisk the egg, oil, milk and vanilla (if using) in a large bowl until combined.
output_quality: Wet mixture is smooth and even

task.description: Add the dry mixture to the wet and fold/mix with a silicone or wooden spoon until just combined. If batter is too thick, add 1–2 Tbsp milk and mix to reach a scoopable muffin batter consistency.
output_quality: Batter is uniform, scoopable, not overly loose
No large pockets of dry flour remain

failure: too thick or too thin batter

instructions.original_text: Rinse and dry your apple, then it is your choice whether you peel it or not. I usually peel mine. Next, chop it up into little chunks; the smaller the better. Add those chunks and fold them into the batter.

task.description: Rinse and dry the apple. Peel if desired. Core and dice into very small chunks.
output_quality: Apple pieces are small (≈0.25-0.5 inch) and uniform

task.description: Gently fold the diced apples into the batter until evenly distributed. Do not overmix.
output_quality: Apple chunks evenly distributed without overworked batter

instructions.original_text: Now make the crumble or streusel topping. Add the softened butter to a medium bowl along with the sugar, flour, and cinnamon. Mix with a fork to make small to large clumps. Make sure there are no dry bits left

task.description: Combine softened butter, sugar, flour and cinnamon in a medium bowl. Use a fork to mix until the mixture forms small-to-medium clumps with no dry flour visible.
output_quality: Mixture forms clumps (streusel) and contains no dry powdery bits

failure: butter melted (should be softened, not liquid)

instructions.original_text: Scoop the batter evenly into a muffin pan with paper cups. If you need a good nonstick muffin pan, the one I have is amazing.

task.description: Line muffin pan with paper cups (or grease). Scoop batter evenly into 12 wells, filling about 3/4 full.
output_quality: Batter evenly distributed across 12 cups (approx equal volumes)

failure: uneven fill - some cups overflow while others underfilled

instructions.original_text: Then sprinkle the crumble/streusel topping evenly on top.

task.description: Sprinkle or pinch crumble topping evenly over each filled muffin cup so each has a layer of streusel.
output_quality: Topping is evenly distributed, visible on each muffin

instructions.original_text: Bake at 400F/205C for 20 to 28 minutes until golden brown on top and a toothpick comes out clean when inserted in the middle of the muffin. In my oven, 25 minutes is usually enough time.

task.description: Place the muffin pan in the preheated oven. Bake at 400°F (205°C) for 20–28 minutes. At ~20 minutes begin checking: muffins are done when tops are golden and a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean or with a few moist crumbs.
output_quality: Toothpick inserted in center comes out clean or with a few moist crumbs
Internal temperature (if measured) around 200°F is acceptable

instructions.original_text: Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for about 5 minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.

task.description: Remove pan from oven. Let muffins rest in the pan for about 5 minutes to set.
output_quality: Muffins have slightly set and release easily from paper cups

failure: removing too soon causes muffins to break

task.description: Transfer muffins from pan to a wire rack and allow to cool completely before storing or serving.
output_quality: Muffins cooled to room temperature on rack

failure: trapping steam under muffins (store after cooling)

task.description: Serve the cooled muffins. Store leftovers in an airtight container at room temperature for 2 days or refrigerate for longer storage.
